result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew T Bowlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court Imposes a Term on Imprisonment of 5 years, consisting of 2 years of Initial Confinement and 3 years of Extended Supervision
The Court STAYS this sentence and Places Mr. Bowlin on Probation for a term of 3 years.

--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes:
FORTHWITH
--With Huber privileges

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

8/9/16: The Court allows the Defendant to perform trustee duties in the jail, effective IMMEDIATELY
The Court reinstates full Huber effective 11/1/2016 for the remainder of the conditional jail time, conditioned upon absolute sobriety.

[ma] Case called at 03:06 PM 
Defendant Andrew T Bowlin in court.   Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Probation Agent Mike Ellestad present in courtroom gallery

Agent indicates that Mr. Bowlin has been making payments but has been applied towards other cases.

ADA Shock makes inquires of Agent 
Agent indicates that Mr. Bowlin has met all conditions of probation except court ordered obligations and restitution. 

Statement made by Mr. Bowlin 

The Court is not convinced Mr. Bowlin has made a good faith effort. 
The Court orders Mr. Bowlin's probation to be extended for one year to allow payment towards court obligations and restitution. 
If payment is made in full prior to the one year mark, the Court will allow Mr. Bowlin's probation to expire. 

The Court recites amounts due according to DOC slip

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 8:43am [mo]
Defendant Andrew T Bowlin in court, in custody with Attorney Philip J. Brehm.  ADA Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On Defendant's Motion for Post Conviction Relief:
Deputy Dylan Agnew--sworn and testifies
--direct examination by Atty. Brehm
--Defendant's Exhibit #1(letter from JCJ indicating revocation of Huber)--offered and received

Defendant, Andrew Bowlin--sworn and testifies
--direct examination by Atty. Brehm
--cross examination by ADA Hall

Statement made by Mike Ellestad, Dane Co. Probation Agent, who is present in the courtroom gallery.

The Court acknowledges review of the Sentencing transcript

Evidence Closed at 8:55am

Arguments given by Atty. Brehm 
Arguments given by ADA Hall
The Court questions ADA Hall

The Court gives Its basis for denying Huber.
The Court rejects the Defense's theory that the Court has a 'blanket policy' re: Huber

The State rejects to full reinstatement of Huber; takes no position on authorization of trustee work within the jail.
Questioning by the Court of Mr. Bowlin

The Court allows the Defendant to perform trustee duties in the jail, effective IMMEDIATELY
The Court reinstates full Huber effective 11/1/2016 for the remainder of the conditional jail time, conditioned upon absolute sobriety.
recess: 9:20am

Case called at 2:11pm [mo]
Defendant Andrew T Bowlin in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--Defense's Exh. #1(ATTIC Correctional Services Letter)--offered
--Cindy Ostrom makes a statement to the Court
--Statement made by Mr. Bowlin

The Court Imposes a Term on Imprisonment of 5 years, consisting of 2 years of Initial Confinement and 3 years of Extended Supervision
The Court STAYS this sentence and Places Mr. Bowlin on Probation for a term of 3 years, with the following conditions:
--serve 1 year in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence FORTHWITH
--Not to possess or consume alcohol or illegal drugs
--Not to possess drug paraphernalia
--No Contact with Joseph and Lynn Sullivan
--No presence at the home of Joseph and Lynn Sullivan or within 1000 feet of their residence
--No presence at the places of employment of Joseph and Lynn Sullivan
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapy or counseling as required by the Agent
--not to associate with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as approved by Agent
--to pay restitution to Joseph and Lynn Sullivan in the amount of $10,000
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay $243 in subpoena fees
--Mr. Bowlin is to submit a letter of apology to the Sullivan's for submission to the Probation office by 1/31/16
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant

41 days sentence credit
The Court orders that Cash Bond is to be applied to Restitution owed.

Case called at 9:51am [mo]
[Scheduled for FSSC]
Defendant Andrew T Bowlin in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Svehlek requests an adjournment of Trial; gives basis
--ADA Hall objects to an adjournment; gives basis

recess: 9:55am--reconvene:9:57am [to allow ADA Hall to speak with the victim]
ADA Hall informs the Court that the victim does not object entering a plea today and scheduling a sentencing hearing

recess: 9:58am--reconvene: 10:17am[to allow Atty. Svehlek to complete plea paperwork]

ADA Hall submits a letter from the victim
--the Court reviews the letter

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "  No Contest " entered on Count #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Bowlin guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: all remaining counts.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 
recess: 10:26am

Motion for continuance is granted

Case called at 9:08 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for Final Status Scheduling Conference)
Defendant Andrew T Bowlin appears via video, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek, who appears in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the video is sight & sound sufficient
Court addresses the motion/stipulation for continuance with parties - Court indicates It did not endorse stipulation as the State indicated that the victim objected to continuance.
ADA Hall informs the Court that they have received no further information from the victim re: objection to continuance, was just a general objection - State does support continuance. Do believe request made by defense is the most expedient way to address the matter.
Atty Svehlek presents arguments in support of continuace
Court grants continuance - State to prepare writ. Court informs Mr. Bowlin to keep in contact with Atty Svehlek regarding all of his moves so the writ is prepared for correct institution.
Recess: 9:15 am

Case called at 8:41am [mo]
Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Andrew T Bowlin appears via video conferencing from Dane Co. Jail, in custody. His Attorney, Yelena Olegovna Zarwell appears in court.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Zarwell aknowledges that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Atty. Zarwell requests a Jury date in September, further she explains this is due to a four month ATR. 
DA Happ does not object this request.
The Court and Counsel have colloquy regarding the age of case and victims of case. 
Atty. Zarwell is to send a letter to the DA and the Court by the last day of May to indicate whether or not her client has been accepted into the ATR program.
